what: This package creates CSV input files for the Lavrentiadis & Abrahamson ECS algorithm.
title: This package creates CSV input files for the Lavrentiadis & Abrahamson ECS algorithm.
text: goal ECSprep create CSV input files Lavrentiadis & Abrahamson Event Cooredinate System (ECS) algorithm user’s SHP files contain rupture fault trace line work /fault displacement measurement sites. two common applications ECS algorithm: Forward-application fault displacement hazard analysis models, user mapped traces active faults. Presentation analysis post-earthquake fault rupture displacement data, user mapped traces surface ruptures sites fault displacement measured.

title: This package creates CSV input files for the Lavrentiadis & Abrahamson ECS algorithm.
text: can install development version ECSprep like :

what: Here is a basic workflow for developing the CSV for the fault traces/ruptures:
title: This package creates CSV input files for the Lavrentiadis & Abrahamson ECS algorithm.
text: User prepares shapefile (SHP) containing mapped traces faults (surface ruptures). recommended user creates Rank attribute assigns “Principal” “Distributed” classifications faults/ruptures. algorithm generally perform better specified, especially fault system surface rupture patterns complex. matter Coordinate Reference System (CRS) used, CRS must assigned. words, PRJ file must present SHP file suite. User runs ECSprep::create_ecs_input fault trace SHP input. script produce CSV creates ordered vertices, latitude longitude coordinates, fault trace/rupture. CRS assigned, error occurs. Rank column present, warning issued automatically added default values “None.” attributes present input SHP retained CSV. CSV output defaults directory input SHP, user can optionally specify alternative path.

what: Check CRS of an sf Object — check_crs
title: Check CRS of an sf Object — check_crs
text: Verifies coordinate reference system (CRS) provided 'sf' object, required specific geographical applications. function halts execution error CRS set.

title: Check CRS of an sf Object — check_crs
Check CRS of an sf Object — check_crs
text: sf_object 'sf' object check, representing geographical features attributes.

title: Check CRS of an sf Object — check_crs
text: return value halts execution error CRS 'sf_object' .

what: Check Geometry Type of an sf Object — check_geometry_type
title: Check Geometry Type of an sf Object — check_geometry_type
text: Validates whether geometry 'sf' object matches specified category. function designed ensure spatial operations performed appropriate geometry types, specifically 'line' 'point' geometries.

title: Check Geometry Type of an sf Object — check_geometry_type
Check Geometry Type of an sf Object — check_geometry_type
text: sf_object 'sf' object, represents spatial features. geom_category string indicating expected geometry category. Accepts 'line' LINESTRING MULTILINESTRING geometries, 'point' POINT MULTIPOINT geometries.

title: Check Geometry Type of an sf Object — check_geometry_type
text: return value halts execution error message 'sf_object''s geometry match expected category.

what: Standardize and Validate 'Rank' Attribute in an sf Object — check_ranking
title: Standardize and Validate 'Rank' Attribute in an sf Object — check_ranking
text: Ensures 'Rank' attribute 'sf' object contains valid values standardizes replacing "Primary" "Principal" "Secondary" "Distributed". checks invalid 'Rank' values stops execution error found.

title: Standardize and Validate 'Rank' Attribute in an sf Object — check_ranking
Standardize and Validate 'Rank' Attribute in an sf Object — check_ranking
text: sf_object 'sf' object 'Rank' attribute.

title: Standardize and Validate 'Rank' Attribute in an sf Object — check_ranking
text: Returns modified 'sf' object 'Rank' attribute standardized validated. invalid 'Rank' values present, execution halted error message.

what: Create ECS Input File from Esri Shapefile — create_ecs_input
title: Create ECS Input File from Esri Shapefile — create_ecs_input
text: Processes Esri shapefile, either line point geometry, input Lavrentiadis & Abrahamson ECS tool. function transforms shapefile's CRS EPSG:4326, adds default 'Rank' field missing, formats data ECS tool input. Output saved CSV file specified default directory. Note file points measurement file, column called 'displ' contains fault displacement measurements required execution halted error message present.

title: Create ECS Input File from Esri Shapefile — create_ecs_input
Create ECS Input File from Esri Shapefile — create_ecs_input
text: in_filepath path input Esri shapefile, recommended use 'file.path()' construction. geometry_type type geometry, 'line' rupture lines 'point' displacement measurement sites. output_folder (Optional) Directory saving output CSV file; defaults 'ECSprep-outputs' input file directory.

title: Create ECS Input File from Esri Shapefile — create_ecs_input
text: Outputs CSV file specified directory prints file location. return value function .

what:
Convert measurement sites to a data frame with necessary attributes for the
ECS Tool — process_points
title:
Convert measurement sites to a data frame with necessary attributes for the
ECS Tool — process_points
text: Transforms 'sf' object containing POINT geometries associated displacement measurements data frame. function tailored preparing input data Lavrentiadis & Abrahamson ECS tool .

title:
Convert measurement sites to a data frame with necessary attributes for the
ECS Tool — process_points

Convert measurement sites to a data frame with necessary attributes for the
ECS Tool — process_points
text: sf_object 'sf' object, expected contain POINT geometries representing measurement sites. column called 'displ' required; execution halted error message column present.

title:
Convert measurement sites to a data frame with necessary attributes for the
ECS Tool — process_points
text: Returns data frame derived input 'sf' object. data frame includes original data, cleaned-invalid displacement values (negative, NaN, NA) coordinates ('Latitude', 'Longitude').

what: Transform sf Object to EPSG:4326 CRS — project_to_4326
title: Transform sf Object to EPSG:4326 CRS — project_to_4326
text: Checks coordinate reference system (CRS) 'sf' object transforms EPSG:4326 already CRS. EPSG:4326 corresponds WGS 84, widely used geographical coordinate system.

title: Transform sf Object to EPSG:4326 CRS — project_to_4326
Transform sf Object to EPSG:4326 CRS — project_to_4326
text: sf_object 'sf' object representing spatial features. function checks , necessary, converts CRS object EPSG:4326.

title: Transform sf Object to EPSG:4326 CRS — project_to_4326
text: Returns 'sf' object EPSG:4326 coordinate reference system. original object already EPSG:4326, returned unchanged.

what:
Convert rupture line work to a data frame of vertices with necessary
attributes for the ECS Tool — rups2verts
title:
Convert rupture line work to a data frame of vertices with necessary
attributes for the ECS Tool — rups2verts
text: Transforms 'sf' object containing LINESTRING geometries data frame vertices. vertex assigned unique node ID within rupture line (RUP_ID) includes latitude longitude coordinates. function tailored preparing input data Lavrentiadis & Abrahamson ECS tool structuring 'sf' object's line work vertex format data frame.

title:
Convert rupture line work to a data frame of vertices with necessary
attributes for the ECS Tool — rups2verts

Convert rupture line work to a data frame of vertices with necessary
attributes for the ECS Tool — rups2verts
text: sf_object 'sf' object, expected contain LINESTRING geometries.

title:
Convert rupture line work to a data frame of vertices with necessary
attributes for the ECS Tool — rups2verts
text: Returns data frame row represents vertex original LINESTRING geometries. data frame includes columns RUP_ID (rupture line ID), NODE_ID (node order within RUP_ID), Latitude/Longitude coordinates.
